articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC Radio 5 Live coverage from the final round of the 152nd Open at Royal Troon.
articles.title: The Open LIVE: Final round - scores, latest leaderboard, video highlights, text & radio commentary

articles.description: Shoaib Bashir takes 5-41 as England surge towards a series victory by blowing away West Indies in a single session on the fourth day of the second Test at Trent Bridge.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Shoaib Bashir takes 5-41 as hosts win second Test at Trent Bridge

articles.description: Xander Schauffele wins second major of his career with a two-shot victory over Justin Rose and Billy Horschel.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Xander Schauffele holds of Justin Rose to win Claret Jug at Royal Troon

articles.description: Tadej Pogocar seals a sensational Tour de France-Giro d'Italia double by winning stage 21's time trial into Nice.
articles.title: Tour de France 2024: Tadej Pogacar wins third title with time trial victory

articles.description: Oscar Piastri takes his maiden grand prix victory in a McLaren one-two ahead of Lando Norris in a dramatic race in Hungary amid a heated row over team orders.
articles.title: Oscar Piastri wins Hungarian Grand Prix after Lando Norris row

articles.description: Nuno Borges says "I know we all wanted Rafa to win" after beating Rafael Nadal in the final of the Swedish Open.
articles.title: Swedish Open final: Nuno Borges beats Rafael Nadal to win title

articles.description: BBC Sport picks out six highly anticipated swimming races to watch at the Paris Olympics, including Adam Peaty's quest for gold and France's new superstar.
articles.title: Paris Olympics 2024: Six swimming races to watch at the Games

articles.description: Tottenham and Denmark midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg is available for about £17m.
articles.title: Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg: Marseille in talks to sign Tottenham midfielder

articles.description: Legendary British cyclist Mark Cavendish says this year's Tour de France is likely to be his last ever race.
articles.title: Mark Cavendish: Briton says Tour de France 'likely' to be his last ever race

articles.description: Liverpool Under-18s leave the pitch in two games after a player alleges he is racially abused during a tournament in Germany.
articles.title: Liverpool U18s walk off pitch twice after alleged racist abuse in Germany
